item.title: Big Lots Files for Bankruptcy, Enters Sale Agreement
item.description: U.S. discount retail chain Big Lots has filed for bankruptcy and agreed to sell itself to an affiliate of private-equity firm Nexus Capital.

item.title: Stock Futures Gain After Torrid Week of Losses
item.description: Markets looked to be on course to recoup a little of the ground lost in recent sessions over concerns about the health of the U.S. economy.

item.title: Stock Futures Gain After Torrid Week of Losses
item.description: Markets looked to be on course to recoup a little of the ground lost in recent sessions over concerns about the health of the U.S. economy.

item.title: Euro Could Fall if ECB Signals Further Rate Cuts
item.description: The euro could give back some of its recent gains if the European Central Bank cuts interest rates on Thursday and indicates sufficient inflation progress to ease policy further, Swissquote Bank said.

item.title: Entain Online Gaming Revenue Tops Forecasts
item.description: Entain said its online net gaming revenue has grown ahead of expectations so far in the second half of year, with the positive momentum of the second quarter continuing.

item.title: Demand Seen Supportive for Ultralong Japanese Government Bonds
item.description: Supply-demand dynamics should be supportive for the super-long maturity sector of the Japanese government bond yield curve, Morgan Stanley Research said.

item.title: China Opens More Sectors to Foreign Investment
item.description: China deepened its push to further open up the economy, eliminating restrictions on the manufacturing sector and expanding opportunities for foreign investment in the health sector.

item.title: September Is Once Again a Tough Month for Stocks
item.description: The S&P 500 fell 4.2% last week on concerns about the health of the U.S. economy. Going back to 1928, September has been stocks’ weakest month of the year.

item.title: Gangs Are Making Millions Helping Indians Cheat on Exams
item.description: Middle-class families pay tens of thousands of dollars to help their children get an unlawful edge in make-or-break exams.

item.title: Speaker Johnson faces the challenge of passing a bill to fund the government while averting a House GOP revolt in the heat of the election.
item.description: Speaker Johnson faces the challenge of passing a bill to fund the government while averting a House GOP revolt in the heat of the election.

item.title: Venezuelan opposition figure Edmundo González, who the U.S. said won July's presidential election, arrived in Spain to seek asylum in a blow to the nation's democracy movement.
item.description: Venezuelan opposition figure Edmundo González, who the U.S. said won July’s presidential election, arrived in Spain to seek asylum in a blow to the nation’s democracy movement.

item.title: A federal judge cleared the way for bettors to place wagers on the outcome of congressional elections via a prediction-market startup.
item.description: A federal judge cleared the way for bettors to place wagers on the outcome of congressional elections via a prediction-market startup.

item.title: Having captured over 100 towns after its incursion into Russia last month, Ukraine finds itself in a new role as an occupier. Zelensky has appointed a military commandant for the area and vows to observe humanitarian laws.
item.description: Having captured over 100 towns after its incursion into Russia last month, Ukraine finds itself in a new role as an occupier. Zelensky has appointed a military commandant for the area and vows to observe humanitarian laws.

item.title: Boeing agreed to raise wages by 25% for its largest union in a four-year pact aimed at preventing a strike, days before a potential walkout that would further strain the company.
item.description: Boeing agreed to raise wages by 25% for its largest union in a four-year pact aimed at preventing a strike, days before a potential walkout that would further strain the company.

item.title: The S&P's 4.2% fall in the first week of September has set the stage for what has historically been the weakest month for stocks.
item.description: The S&P’s 4.2% fall in the first week of September has set the stage for what has historically been the weakest month for stocks.

item.title: The mother of the 14-year-old Georgia shooting suspect called the school the morning of the attack to warn of a possible emergency, a family member said.
item.description: The mother of the 14-year-old Georgia shooting suspect called the school the morning of the attack to warn of a possible emergency, a family member said.

item.title: A lawsuit backed by a fossil-fuel billionaire, alleging that Greenpeace USA illegally incited protests against the Dakota Access Pipeline, heads for trial with the environmental group warning it faces bankruptcy if it loses.
item.description: A lawsuit backed by a fossil-fuel billionaire, alleging that Greenpeace USA illegally incited protests against the Dakota Access Pipeline, heads for trial with the environmental group warning it faces bankruptcy if it loses.

item.title: Videogame job cuts have ended the industry's reliability as a career for thousands, including many veteran employees.
item.description: Videogame job cuts have ended the industry’s reliability as a career for thousands, including many veteran employees.

item.title: U.S. antitrust enforcers are intervening early to examine whether a handful of big tech companies such as Nvidia are using their leverage to establish dominance over the burgeoning AI market.
item.description: U.S. antitrust enforcers are intervening early to examine whether a handful of big tech companies such as Nvidia are using their leverage to establish dominance over the burgeoning AI market.

item.title: Apple is holding its fall product unveiling with the hope that a new AI feature will help sell more phones.
item.description: Apple is holding its fall product unveiling with the hope that a new AI feature will help sell more phones.
